results.title: Kath and Kim. Series 2 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ted Emery, Gina Riley, Jane Turner, Mark Ruse and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Second series of the acerbic slice-of-life comedy show, “Kath & Kim” satirises the ambitions, aesthetics, language and aspirations of the working class. Kath (Jane Turner), a forty-something homeowner, fashion and fitness conscious woman, is newlywed to Kel (Glenn Robbins) the butcher. The bane of Kath’s life is her disgruntled, spoilt and indulged daughter Kim, a tasteless, overweight and overbearing fashion victim. Written and created by Gina Riley and Jane Turner. The announcement: Kath struggles with her libido and flagging marriage to Kel; Kim tries to win back her estranged husband, Brett. Inside out: Kim and Brett consider renovations, as well as procreation. The Moon: Second best friend Sharon helps out Kim despite her appalling demeanour; Sharon attends a class reunion; Kath plans a honeymoon. Obsession: Kath and Kel embark upon a new health and fitness regime; Kim struggles with her choices as a wife, humiliating Brett; Sharon takes up river dancing; Kath and Kel attend a plastic surgery clinic. My Boyfriend: Brett and Kim become separated in the largest furniture store in the Southern hemisphere; Sharon acquires a boyfriend; the netball final becomes a heated affair. Another announcement: Kim and Kath go shopping for the baby; Brett and Kim attend birthing classes, clashing over a range of issues. The Shower: Kath meets Kel’s sleazy best mate Sandy; Sharon plans Kim’s baby shower. The Hideous Truth: Kim awaits the birth of her child; Kath experiences flashbacks from her tumultuous first marriage.

results.title: Kath & Kim: series 3 [DVD]
results.brief_description: Third series in this hilarious satire about a middle class family living out their dreams in suburbia, continues the story of Kath and Kel, Kim and Brett, Epponnee and second best friend, Sharon. Episode 1: Kath has mixed feelings about the return of Kim’s Dad. Kim experiences the joys of motherhood. Episode 2: The ladies hit the races. Episode 3: Brett has a family crisis; Kath and Kel spread their (social) wings. Episode 4: Kim plans to shed the pounds. Episode 5: Sharon has a hot date; Kath becomes addicted to TV. Episode 6: Kath and Kim consider new career paths. Episode 7: Birthday celebrations create chaos in the Day-Knight household. Episode 8: A peak into the future for the residents of Lagoon Court. Special guest appearance by Kylie Minogue. Created and written by Gina Riley and Jane Turner.

results.title: Kath & Kim
results.brief_description: Kath & Kim is a character-driven Australian television situation comedy series. The series was created by, and is written by Jane Turner and Gina Riley who play the title characters: a suburban mother and daughter with a dysfunctional relationship.

constellations_other.name: 2000s TV
constellations_other.description: The dawn of the new millennium brought a wave of Australian programming that was more ambitious and bolder than previous decades.

results.description:
Kath & Kim is a character-driven Australian television situation comedy series. The series was created by, and is written by Jane Turner and Gina Riley who play the title characters: a suburban mother and daughter with a dysfunctional relationship. The series main characters consist of Kath Day-Knight, a cheerful 50-year-old woman, her self-indulgent daughter Kim Craig, Kath’s boyfriend and second husband, the metrosexual Kel Knight, as well as Kim’s estranged husband Brett Craig and her lonely, overweight “second best friend” Sharon Strzelecki. The series is set in the fictional suburb of Fountain Lakes in Melbourne. It is primarily filmed in Patterson Lakes.

The series was conceived by Turner and Riley in the early 1990s as a weekly segment of the Australian comedy series Fast Forward. The skit was then developed into a full-series. The first series of Kath & Kim premiered on ABC TV on 16 May 2002, with three further series following, while a television movie, entitled Da Kath and Kim Code, was broadcast nationally on 25 November 2005. Kath & Kim has garnered much critical acclaim since its debut, winning two Logie Awards, for “Outstanding Comedy Programme” and the “Best Television Drama Series” award at the Australian Film Institute Awards. In Australia, it has become a pop culture phenomenon, and is a success with audiences nationwide. Internationally, the series has spawned a cult fanbase, and in 2006 it was announced an American version of the series would be produced, to air on NBC. Riley and Turner served as executive producers on the US version. The American version was also picked up by Seven, which debuted the program on 12 October 2008, just three days after its debut in the United States.
description_for_label:

The series was created by, and is written by Jane Turner and Gina Riley who play the title characters: a suburban mother and daughter with a dysfunctional relationship. The series main characters consist of Kath Day-Knight, a cheerful 50-year-old woman, her self-indulgent daughter Kim Craig, Kath’s boyfriend and second husband, the metrosexual Kel Knight, as well as Kim’s estranged husband Brett Craig and her lonely, overweight “second best friend” Sharon Strzelecki. The series is set in the fictional suburb of Fountain Lakes in Melbourne. It is primarily filmed in Patterson Lakes.

The first series of Kath & Kim premiered on ABC TV on 16 May 2002, with three further series following, while a television movie, entitled Da Kath and Kim Code, was broadcast nationally on 25 November 2005. Kath & Kim has garnered much critical acclaim since its debut, winning two Logie Awards, for “Outstanding Comedy Programme” and the “Best Television Drama Series” award at the Australian Film Institute Awards. In Australia, it has become a pop culture phenomenon, and is a success with audiences nationwide. Internationally, the series has spawned a cult fanbase, and in 2006 it was announced an American version of the series would be produced, to air on NBC. Riley and Turner served as executive producers on the US version. The American version was also picked up by Seven, which debuted the program on 12 October 2008, just three days after its debut in the United States.

results.title: Kate Plays Christine
results.creator_credit: Prewar Cinema Productions, 4th Row Films, Faliro House Productions, House of Nod, Robert Greene, Douglas Tirola and Susan Bedusa
results.brief_description: Follow actress Kate Lyn Sheil as she prepares for her next role: playing Christine Chubbuck, a Florida newscaster who committed suicide live on-air in 1974. As Kate investigates Chubbuck’s story, uncovering new clues and information, she becomes increasingly obsessed with her subject.

results.title: Kate and Anna McGarrigle
results.creator_credit: Caroline Leaf, Derek Lamb and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Using a combination of animation and documentary techniques, filmmaker Caroline Leaf has created an easygoing mood in this informal portrait of the acclaimed singer-songwriters from Quebec. Highlights of the film include excerpts from their dibut concert at Carnegie Hall; a look at the songwriting/recording process, McGarrigle style; and conversations with the sisters, their supporters, and their critics.

results.title: Kataragama: a god for all seasons
results.creator_credit: Charlie Nairn and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Disappearing world”.
The story of how the parents of an eleven-year old Sri Lankan boy consulted an astrologer to help them find their son. The astrologer instructs them to seek help from the god, Kataragama, who correctly forecast the boy would be returned in twenty one days. Shows scenes of worshippers of Kataragama who thank him for favours received by walking through pits of red hot fire. Some hung themselves from butcher’s hooks impaled in their backs.

results.title: Karl Marx
results.brief_description: Academy award winner Bruce Petty has made this entertaining animation on the life and times of Karl Marx. Ambitious in its scope, the film attempts to put the economic history of Europe since the Industrial Revolution into a Marxist perspective. Narrators include Robyn Nevin, Arthur Dignam and Kate Fitzpatrick.
results.description: Academy award winner Bruce Petty has made this entertaining animation on the life and times of Karl Marx. results.title: Kariba: power for Central Africa
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Independent Television News (GB)
results.brief_description: On 17 May 1960, Queen Elizabeth, the Queen mother, opened the Kariba Dam in Northern Rhodesia. The story of its construction and the difficulties which had to be overcome before the remote Kariba Gorge could become the biggest man-made lake in the world. Building a road into the Gorge; how floods disrupted progress; the power house; pouring the concrete and clearing the rising waters of timber. What the increased water supply and electric power will mean to Central Africa.
